Description: Papyrus fragment bearing 5 lines of a Coptic text written along the fibres (recto). The right edge of the papyrus is folded over. EA 75320, 75319, 75318, 75317, 75316, 75315 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Provenance: this text was probably written by a monk of the Monastery of Apa Apollo at Titkooh. This small fragment may provide an example of the formula 'anok pason NN eishai' (i.e. 'I, brother NN, am writing') as used by a monk of the Monastery of Apa Apollo at Titkooh.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 137, pl.47)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86611) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86611)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
